Key Findings: Elastic modulus ≈198 GPa (163–229 GPa) and Young’s modulus 269 GPa; high storage capacity 1.68 wt% at 25 °C with good sorption kinetics.; Mean elastic modulus 198 GPa; varied from 186 to 215 GPa across compression cycles.; Mean indentation elastic modulus = 294 ± 60 GPa; domains I‑IV show modulus 265‑384 GPa and hardness 9.2‑25.4 GPa.
Comments: Ti0.5Fe0.45Mn0.05 intermetallic studied for hydrogen storage.; Alloy shows heterogeneous microstructure and elasto‑plastic behavior.; Strong microscale heterogeneity; pre‑existing cracks reduce macroscopic stiffness.
